Posted By: EKraj (1/26/2013 1:55:16 PM)

posts.post_content:
Go infinite with [Aphetto Alchemist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aphetto Alchemist) Untappathon. :)  
  
Yeah, [Seeker of Skybreak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seeker of Skybreak) and [Tidewater Minion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tidewater Minion) work nearly as well. But people already recognize those two from Elf/Merfolk infinite combo decks, and using the copied effect to untap an artifact opens up many more options for the kill card. Nobody, I mean *nobody*, will have any idea what Aphetto Alchemist is or why you are playing it... until you go infie and it's too late.  
  
A lot of already-existing infinite combos don't benefit from copying the ability, so this card isn't quiiiiite as "OMG BROKEN" as it seems at first. What we'll really benefit from is having plausible options, alternatives. For example, pretty much every [Pili-Pala](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pili-Pala) combo out there is easier to pull off with Illusionist's Bracers, since it basically fulfills the same role as a [Training Grounds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Grounds) / [Rings of Brighthearth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rings of Brighthearth) / [Heartston](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartston)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
This has got to be the favorite equipment of [Arcanis the Omnipotent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcanis the Omnipotent). Tap for TWO [Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall)s? Uncounterable (mostly) at that?? Yes please.  
  
Regeneration/Undying/Persist creatures getting you down? Hit em with a double-barrel blast from [Magus of the Disk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Disk)!  
  
Heck even anything with a [Dragon Breath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Breath)-type ability is awesome with this. I'm going to be thinking up combos for a long time...  
  
JUST TO CLARIFY  
  
Look at the Gatecrash FAQ's. Scroll down to Illusionist's Bracer's. It says,  
  
"An activated ability is written in the form 'Cost: Effect.'"   
(http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtg/faq/gtc)  
  
Illusionist's Bracer's only copies Activated abilities. It does NOT copy Triggered abilities, nor does it copy Static abilities.  
  
@Chuck85  
No. Please read what I type before asking questions. Geist's ability says "When Geist of Saint Traft attacks;" that is a triggered ability. Activated... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Rule 602.1c  
  
An activated ability is the only kind of ability that can be activated. If an object or rule refers to activating an ability without specifying what kind, it must be referring to an activated ability  
  
I hope this ends the confusion
posts.html:
Rule 602.1c

An activated ability is the only kind of ability that can be activated. If an object or rule refers to activating an ability without specifying what kind, it must be referring to an activated ability

Posted By: Smoke_Stack (2/5/2013 11:07:39 AM)

posts.post_content: Deserves a 5 imo, and here's why. Copies of abilities enter the stack, therefor occur before the original instance of the ability. Let's say you have a [Krenko, Mob Boss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krenko, Mob Boss) out with one Bracer on, and 2 other Goblins. You tap him to activate his ability. Bracers copies it, and takes effect first. You get 3 Goblin tokens and the copy resolves. Then his original ability happens, and you now have 6 Goblins so you get 6 more. Imagine having more than one Bracer on even! Such an insane card and not even just for Krenko. [Beguiler of Wills](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Beguiler of Wills) can give you a stronger creature than she could have alone because you'll control the one you gained from the Bracer's copy before her original instance occurs.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
This is such a fun card, some examples:  
Bane Alley broker, draw 2, exile 2  
Borborygmos, discard land deals 6 damage  
All the Guidmages  
Foundry champion  
Frilled Oculus 2: +4/+4 ueot  
Gateway shade +2/+2 or +4/+4  
Undercity informer, mill twice  
Zairichi Tiger, gain 4 life  
 And thats just from Gatecrash!  
  
I can't wait to pick up one of these and try it out. What i love most is it doubles the effect of the activated ability but not the cost. So you are basically paying for two abilities with 1 cost. Insane!
